subject: Relationships
title: Interracial Marriage: Loving v. Virginia
description: Learn Interracial Marriage: Loving v. Virginia in one minute.

hook.text: In 1958, Richard and Mildred Loving were arrested for being married. Their crime: he was white, she was Black.

buildup.text: Anti-miscegenation laws banned interracial marriage in 16 US states. The Lovings were sentenced to prison or exile.

discovery.text: They fought to the Supreme Court. In 1967, Loving v. Virginia struck down all racial marriage bans nationwide.

twist.text: Alabama didn't officially remove its anti-miscegenation law from the books until the year 2000.

climax.text: The right to marry who you love â€” regardless of race â€” was illegal in America just 57 years ago.

punchline.text: Interracial marriage was a crime in America until 1967. Love won in court.

quiz.question: What did the Loving v. Virginia ruling accomplish?
options: Struck down all racial marriage bans
